text: And when @WellsFargo then named Tim Sloan CEO – a 30-year Wells Fargo executive who got rich off the fake accounts scandal & helped cover it up – I called for his removal too. (He was.) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mRkJhoTGc_c&feature=youtu.be

If Congress won’t act, I will.

Nine years after Dodd-Frank was enacted, Republicans are still determined to tear away measures put in place to protect consumers following the Great Recession. It’s time to put Americans’ savings above the profits of the companies who wrought havoc on our economy. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EACd70DXYAAgjHe.jpg

We can't be silent in the face of Trump's racist attacks. I'll defend anyone—Republican or Democrat—who is attacked because of their religion, their ethnicity, or the color of their skin. I don't give a damn about the politics: racism is racism. In 2013, I asked why a kid caught with an ounce of drugs will go to jail, but a bank exec that launders a billion dollars in drug money pays a fine and gets to go home to sleep in their own bed at night. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7cKTBy7_S_I&feature=youtu.be

Working families have been left behind, while those at the top have reaped the benefits. When elected, I will reverse Trump’s trillion-dollar tax scam and put money back in the pockets of middle-class families.

Commissions are usually bipartisan investigatory bodies to deeply dive into specific events or areas of US policy.

I could also see proposals for Commissions on the Opioid Crisis, Income Inequality, & Child Trauma, too.

What commissions would you want to see Congress establish?

I’m the author & lead sponsor of the 21st Century Glass-Steagall Act, legislation to separate boring commercial banking (checking & savings accounts) from risky investment banking, to make our financial system safer & prevent another Wall St bailout.

But I learned something in that fight for Dodd-Frank nine years ago today: You don’t get what you don’t fight for. I’m honored to have the opportunity to use every tool in the toolbox to hold Wall Street accountable & make our government work for the people.

The desire to see, hear and have teeth in your mouth is a part of health care.

Medicare for All improves Medicare to guarantee every man, woman and child in America can get the eyeglasses, hearing aids and dental care they need.
